titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Harry B. Goldstein (1908-1991) was an avid birder and a member of the Delaware Valley Ornithological Club and the Cooper Ornithological Club.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of notebooks, journals, checklists, and other documentation related to Goldstein's birding activities. There are 23 notebooks containing lists of birds sited, and narrative descriptions of birding trips in Pennsylvania and New Jersey, as well as many other parts of the world, including India, Israel, Central America, and Jamaica, dating from 1936 to 1986. One journal includes Goldstein's reflections on his "hoboing" adventures from the 1920s to 1950s. There are also 45 notebooks listing plants, animals, and birds seen from the 1930s to 1983. Some volumes include location and weather information. The collection also includes several printed daily checklists for birds seen; a scrapbook entitled "Little Nature Studies" with photographs, drawings, charts, and newspaper clippings; manuscripts for "Birds of Israel," "Random Thoughts of a Naturalist" and "Our Allies-the Snakes"; and additional birding notes.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
